pros: Cary is fully willing to train and teach the right people even without a degree. Generally very friendly environment.
cons: Behind the times on current technology.

pros: Full time Co-Workers Work-Life Balance Holidays Technology
cons: Supervisors Pay Understanding Managerial Mentality Grandfathered In

review_title: Very negative and unprofessional work environment.
pros: I did end up having a decent schedule where I didn't have to work shifts.
cons: Very cliquish - at times I felt like I was back in high school! Lack of common courtesy - people will walk right by you in the hallway and totally ignore you. Very negative - people generally act like they are totally miserable. Very unprofessional - people in so-called management positions who don't have the first clue on how to manage people, and dress like slobs to boot! Your hard work and accomplishments are not recognized unless you are among "the chosen few". The CEO's face is plastered on everything that has to do with Cary Medical Center like the hospital is all about her instead of about the patients and the hard-working employees!

review_title: Salary and Benefits Going in Reverse
pros: The co-workers are great people dedicated to their professions. They desire to provide excellent patient care. They are thankful just to have jobs.
cons:
Direct manager has know idea what the front-line workers actually do!
Management is generally indifferent to workflow improvement suggestions.
Management doesn't solicit input from the front-line workers for ANYTHING.
Management is unconcerned with staff development and promotion.
Instead of adopting a modern intra-departmental style, management is developing a silo-mentality.
Pay/hours keep going backwards. People say they are making LESS than when they started. They regret buying houses in the area. Now they are stuck!
Great potential but, after six years, very disappointing. Enough is enough!

job_title: Community Relations Coordinator in Caribou, ME
pros: Flexible schedule is very important to me, and in communications/PR I am able to flex my hours as my supervisor knows that I will get the job done well. I get good feedback from managers and team members. I love the work that I do.
cons: Salary could be better, but I guess for northern Maine it is okay.

pros: One of few places that has full time positions. Co workers are generally great and things get done. Small hospital so everyone knows everyone.
cons: Management is poor, benefits are not good for the cost, all that management cares about is how much money the hospital is making instead of patient care, pay is low and they never want to pay overtime even if it is needed.

pros: Good benefits when working in a full time position. Employees are great people but management not so much.
cons: Management is incompetent and treats employees unfairly. They play favorites and communication in the workplace is very poor.

job_title: Family Nurse Practitioner in Caribou, ME
pros: Cary was a very nice place to work. Positive corporate culture. Professional folks to work with
cons: None, I worked there for 18 years part time. I drove 56 miles to work there.

job_title: Locum Tenens Physician in Caribou, ME
pros: Friendly helpful staff.  Someone always willing to guide you. Management proactive.
cons: No NICU.  OR small but staff good.
